Articles.Content:
**KSP 1.3 and Chaka Monkey Exploration Systems 1.2.2 are not compatible at this time.** 

**Thank you for your continued support and patience!**

**Regards,**

**Y.C.**
Thx for this precisison ;-)
![4bd556aacd.jpg](https://i.imgsafe.org/4bd556aacd.jpg)

![4c7e038b77.jpg](https://i.imgsafe.org/4c7e038b77.jpg)

**Chaka 1.3**

**First Spashdown**

![4caf7a1837.jpg](https://i.imgsafe.org/4caf7a1837.jpg)

![4caf84fd7a.jpg](https://i.imgsafe.org/4caf84fd7a.jpg)

**Edited <time datetime="2017-06-05T03:08:45Z" title="06/05/2017 03:08  AM" data-short="7 yr">June 5, 2017</time> by YANFRET**

**Chaka 1.3**

**SLS Block I - Orion First Flight**

![62119d1f0f.jpg](https://i.imgsafe.org/62119d1f0f.jpg)

![6211adcf16.jpg](https://i.imgsafe.org/6211adcf16.jpg)

![7562a9025e.jpg](https://i.imgsafe.org/7562a9025e.jpg)

**Edited <time datetime="2017-06-07T01:26:37Z" title="06/07/2017 01:26  AM" data-short="7 yr">June 7, 2017</time> by YANFRET**

![8b5dc391fb.jpg](https://i.imgsafe.org/8b5dc391fb.jpg)

![8be9f9a64d.jpg](https://i.imgsafe.org/8be9f9a64d.jpg)

**Thanks to the quick and decisive work of [@rsparkyc](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/141917-rsparkyc/) and swiftly granted permission from [@e-dog](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/73796-e-dog/), procedural fairings have been recompiled for 1.3 and are working perfectly.**

**That was the last step needed for update. We're going to take a few days to review the pack and craft and then you will have it!**

**Edited <time datetime="2017-06-08T03:04:28Z" title="06/08/2017 03:04  AM" data-short="7 yr">June 8, 2017</time> by YANFRET**

*"Dear Chaka, they say you are really neat, but it has been a while since you've added any new major parts to the pack. What's up with that?"*

**Squad / Chaka Inflatable Heat Shield Type II:**

![b8063db484.jpg](https://i.imgsafe.org/b8063db484.jpg)

![b8064ef7f3.jpg](https://i.imgsafe.org/b8064ef7f3.jpg)

![b80646ec69.jpg](https://i.imgsafe.org/b80646ec69.jpg)

![b8bbaa9ad8.jpg](https://i.imgsafe.org/b8bbaa9ad8.jpg)

**Edited <time datetime="2017-06-10T16:13:55Z" title="06/10/2017 04:13  PM" data-short="7 yr">June 10, 2017</time> by YANFRET**

Introducing:

**Chaka M-Rover**  **** 

**The ultimate roving machine.**

![cad025d87d.jpg](https://i.imgsafe.org/cad025d87d.jpg)

For several versions, the rovers in Chaka Monkey have had poor driving dynamics. Not anymore. A complete redesign of the wheel hardware using the latest model from Squad, and increased wheel size, gives this version the ability to control itself on any extrakerbin surface.

**Edited <time datetime="2017-06-11T02:41:36Z" title="06/11/2017 02:41  AM" data-short="7 yr">June 11, 2017</time> by YANFRET**

Hey [@YANFRET](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/90547-yanfret/), do you know is there an easy way to delete parts from this pack client side? I love it, but a lot of the parts I just don't use, and they make the game load so much slower. Thanks, and apologies if this has already been addressed in this thread.

> 
> 
> 7 hours ago, OswaldiusB said:
> 
> 
> Hey [@YANFRET](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/90547-yanfret/), do you know is there an easy way to delete parts from this pack client side? I love it, but a lot of the parts I just don't use, and they make the game load so much slower. Thanks, and apologies if this has already been addressed in this thread.
> 

<iframe data-embedcontent="" frameborder="0" src="https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/147463-130-end-your-parts-list-nightmare-introducing-the-janitors-closet/&do=embed"></iframe>

> 
> 
> 52 minutes ago, TheRagingIrishman said:
> 
> 
> <iframe data-embedcontent="" frameborder="0" src="https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/147463-130-end-your-parts-list-nightmare-introducing-the-janitors-closet/&do=embed"></iframe>
> 

I already use Janitor's Closet, but I'd just prefer not to have the parts at all as they cause the game and part menus to load slower.

> 
> 
> 35 minutes ago, OswaldiusB said:
> 
> 
> I already use Janitor's Closet, but I'd just prefer not to have the parts at all as they cause the game and part menus to load slower.
> 

You can use the PermaPrune feature of Janitor's closet to prevent the parts from loading at all.

> 
> 
> On 6/11/2017 at 8:30 PM, TheRagingIrishman said:
> 
> 
> You can use the PermaPrune feature of Janitor's closet to prevent the parts from loading at all.
> 

this is such a great feature!

> 
> 
> On 6/11/2017 at 6:30 PM, TheRagingIrishman said:
> 
> 
> You can use the PermaPrune feature of Janitor's closet to prevent the parts from loading at all.
> 

Ok thanks a lot, I didn't know about this feature ![:confused:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_huh.gif ":confused:")![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")

> 
> 
> 4 hours ago, OswaldiusB said:
> 
> 
> Ok thanks a lot, I didn't know about this feature ![:confused:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_huh.gif ":confused:")![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")
> 

We did a few studies a while back on splitting out the 3.75 craft into a separate pack, but then you end up with Orion and several other systems in both... so it just really got complicated. 

If you have a list of favorite parts or systems we could slice you out a piece of pie easily, since we know where everything is and what it does.

**M-Rover passes critical flight test.**

**Handling on Duna surface is a triumph of Kerbal engineering.**
